Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ```
If this is indeed the case, i.e. transactions are just broadcasted as-is to the entire network, then the attacker can easily see the original transaction graph with just a single malicious node, and the later obfuscation in the block doesn't matter anymore.
```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> p2p layer is brutal for privacy coins

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Crypto99 in MW, there are no transactions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> There are only Blocks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and Blocks basically can have lots of transactions in them, but they are all mixed together into one "unit"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> A Block, the transaction graph only exists in the p2p network

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the tx graph does not exist on the blockchain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> they call them "transaction kernels" i think, and you can add as many kernels to your Block as you want

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> p2p messages pass these kernels around

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and they make a block out of them

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> Dummy UXTOs ...nice

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> This is why originally, ITM/metaverse stuff was not clear applied to MW

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> but, it does, because we can extract a tx graph. BUT, we can not do it retroactively

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> obviously, the NSA+friends have been recording BEAM since their genblock

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> But if you wanted that data, where you gonna get it?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> We must start recording right now if we wanted it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> üòÖ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the same applies to BTC

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Biz> that is a very big strength of MW... but it is merely a tall fence really

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> recording the BTC p2p layer can give you immense data

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> Shrimpy API lol... exchange tx history

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is unavailable on explorers or even full nodes

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> Bc traders need it for their bots

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> such as "Which IP in the world broadcasted this txid FIRST?"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> no, i am talking about de-anon, de-privatizing stuff

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this is what spooks do

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> No graphs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if they want

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> they love graphs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> Graphs, linkability and clustering

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @Biz i agree it's a tall fence for average attacker, but it's not much at all for nation-state adversaries

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and if you know everything goes to shit when a Real Attacker is after you, why do anything at all?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> How about a dust attack?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> what about it?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> what do you mean by that term and in what context?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It has a lot of meanings

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> I mean sending a small amount of the same coin to multiple addresses

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> To reveal several identities

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> Or within a block

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Dust attacks exist in Monero and Zcash world and there are various kinds with different intentions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> You can DoS with a dust attack, or you can de-anonymize

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> dusting taddrs can reveal different things than dusting zaddrs, but it's all about extracting metadata

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Crypto99> MW transactions are in plaintext for the miners
